name: GotVoice
overview:
GotVoice creates digital voice applications that allow consumers and businesses to unify their voice communications through their email, mobile phones, or via the GotVoice Website.

The features of its products include Voicemail-to-Text, Visual Voicemail, the ability to share voice messages as digital audio files, and the unification of wireless, landline, PBX and VoIP voicemail.

Founded in 2003 by industry executives from RealNetworks, Microsoft, Starwave, AT&T and Corbis, GotVoice works with all major mobile, business and residential carriers.

milestones.description: GotVoice Technology Provides ShoreTel's Customers With Seamless Voicemail-to-Text Solution
milestones.source_text:
KIRKLAND, WA--(MARKET WIRE)--Jul 9, 2008 -- GotVoice, Inc. (www.gotvoice.com), the voice messaging company, today announced that the company has partnered with ShoreTel to offer the GotVoice Voicemail-To-Text solution to all of ShoreTel's Pure IP Unified Communications customers. By integrating ShoreTel's leading Pure IP Unified Communications solutions with the award-winning GotVoice Voicemail-to-Text service, users can receive voicemail as text in their e-mail inbox, making it easy for ShoreTel customers to instantly read and understand their voice messages.

ADVERTISEMENT
By offering extremely reliable and scalable solutions that are easy to install and use, ShoreTel makes it possible for businesses of any size to seamlessly integrate communications with business processes, creating a more collaborative and productive enterprise -- at the lowest total cost of ownership. Through its partnership with GotVoice, ShoreTel users can activate GotVoice's best-of-class G2 Voicemail-To-Text service in less than 5 minutes.

"Partnering with ShoreTel broadens our business customer base and provides users with the ability to read their voicemail as text at a glance," said Curt Blake, CEO of GotVoice. "ShoreTel is leading a movement to improve overall Unified Communications in a fiercely competitive market when business users are seeking out differentiation. Adding our G2 Voicemail-to-Text solution to its offerings provides ShoreTel with a more comprehensive platform -- and leg up on competition."

"ShoreTel is laser-focused on customer satisfaction and we pride ourselves on consistently helping companies lower the cost and complexity of their communications infrastructure," said Mark Arman, Vice President of Business Development for ShoreTel. "By partnering with GotVoice, our customers have access to the market leading next-generation voicemail-to-text solution, featuring seamless interoperability across our full product line." In addition to its Voicemail-To-Text offering for the ShoreTel Pure IP solution, GotVoice provides customers with the ability to add their home and mobile phones to their GotVoice account and receive all of their voicemail as text and digital audio.

GotVoice G2 provides users with unmatched voicemail-to-text accuracy and speed by utilizing advanced free-form speech recognition technology; the voicemail transcription engine has been trained against millions of voicemails spoken by users across the country.

About GotVoice, Inc.

A pioneer in voice messaging services, GotVoice (www.gotvoice.com) enables the convergence of everyday voice into the digital world. Its patented communications platform empowers consumers and businesses to receive, consume and unify voice communications utilizing email clients, through their mobile phone interface or via the GotVoice Website. With popular features such as Voicemail-to-Text, Visual Voicemail, the ability to share voice messages as digital audio files and the unification of wireless, landline, PBX and VoIP voicemail, GotVoice makes seamless communication possible, anywhere. Founded in 2003 by industry veterans with backgrounds from RealNetworks, Microsoft, Starwave, AT&T and Corbis, GotVoice works with all major mobile, business and residential carriers.
milestones.source_description: GotVoice Technology Provides ShoreTel's Customers With Seamless Voicemail-to-Text Solution
